todos.title: Determine Your Best Learning Method
todos.body: Visual, Auditory, Reading/Writing, Kinesthetic.

todos.title: Competitive Programming
todos.body: SPOJ, Codechef, Codeforces, Topcoder, Hackerrank, Geeksforgeeks.

todos.title: Math & Computer Problems
todos.body: Project Euler

todos.title: Websites to Learn
todos.body: LeetCode, HackerRank

todos.title: Code Review
todos.body: Code Review, a Stack Overflow community.  Get a review of your code.  Take a look at the beginners section.

todos.title: Don't Give Up
todos.body: Beat the learning curves.

todos.title: Google Error Messages
todos.body: Your not the first person to usually have this problem.  Play around with what you Google.  Think about your true problem, the correct terminology, and the frameworks or context you are working in as you assemble your search queries.  Leave out filler words.

todos.title: Visual Learner
todos.body: Use mind maps, videos, diagrams.

todos.title: Diversity
todos.body: Take projects that will allow you to learn different parts of a language.

todos.title: 20 Minute Rule
todos.body: Take atleast 20 minutes to figure something out before you even think of asking for help.  Strengthening your problem solving skills is more important than your knowledge of languages.

todos.title: Post Questions Online
todos.body: Take advantage of Stack Overflow or Reddit's Programming.  Remember, there are sections just for beginners.

todos.title: Debug
todos.body: Step through code to see how it works.  Open up the objects as the code is loading to understand what's inside of them.

todos.title: Don't Stop Studying
todos.body: Spend time each day studyi

todos.title: Inspect Code
todos.body: Right click on pages and inspect how the code is compiled.

todos.title: Official Docs
todos.body: Read the languages official docs and code while you are doing it so you can see how it works.

todos.title: Compare Languages
todos.body: Look for things that look familiar and act the same, things that look familiar but do something unexpected, and things that look new.

todos.title: Learn Theory
todos.body: Learn the lingo and jargon that occur in every language (loops, variables, methods, etc.).

todos.title: Build Something
todos.body: Jump in and build.  Quantity over quality when you're first starting.

todos.title: Learn Problem Solving
todos.body: Improve skills at pattern recognition, algorithms, and abstractions.

todos.title: Coding Games
todos.body: Hour of Code, Minecraft Educational Edition, CodinGame.

todos.title: Read a lot of code
todos.body: Go to GitHub and read a bunch of code.  This is the only way you will learn to code idiomatically.

todos.title: Mentor
todos.body: Get a mentor that can help you.  Make sure to return the value to that person or pass it on.

todos.title: Install Linting Tools
todos.body: Flags bugs, idiomatic offenses, style errors and more.

todos.title: Create List of Questions
todos.body: Find an expert to answer your list once compiled.

todos.title: Take a Breather
todos.body: Don't forget to step away from your computer and let your brain retain information you learned and think of more efficient solutions to a problem.

todos.title: Coding Video Channels
todos.body: CS Dojo, TheNetNinja, Kudvenkat, CS50, LinkedIn Learning's video library.

todos.title: Treat yourself
todos.body: Create positive reinforcements every time you hit a milestone.

todos.title: Lookup Projects
todos.body: Create a project per language that has the fundamentals you can refer back to.

todos.title: Reverse Engineer
todos.body: Clone someone else's code and try to add onto it or make changes.

todos.title: Free Online Courses
todos.body: Check out Harvard's CS50X Intro to Computer Science course.  You can audit courses free via edX and watch lectures on YouTube.

todos.title: Online Camps
todos.body: Check out FreeCodeCamp.

todos.title: Technical Interview Preparation
todos.body: Check out Cracking the Coding Interview, LeetCode, Gainlo, Glassdoor.

todos.title: Coding Academies
todos.body: Check out Codecademy, freeCodeCamp, edX, Codewars, GA Dash, MIT OpenCourseware, SoloLearn (mobile), The Code Player, Haskr.io, W3Schools, Microsoft Virtual Academy, Edabit, Launch School Open Book Shelf, LearnCode.academy, Css-Tricks, Lean Enough Command Line to Be Dangerous, Command Line Power User, Git Immersion, Try Git, Javascript for Cats, NodeSchool, Eloquent Javascript, Javascript.com, Cybrary, The Encyclopedia of Human Computer Interaction, UXPin, UX Beginner

todos.title: Clone Popular Sites
todos.body: Build imitation sites.  Start simple.

todos.title: ng.  Use notecards or phone apps to study on the toilet, in the bath, while in waiting rooms.
